May 1904

May 1904 was the fifth month of the year 1904, a leap year. It was a significant month for various reasons, including the ongoing Russo-Japanese War, the construction of the Panama Canal, and the rise of the automobile industry. This article provides a comprehensive overview of the events that took place during this month.

# May 1, 1904 (Sunday)

May 1, 1904, was a Sunday, and it marked the beginning of a new month. In many countries, May Day was celebrated as a public holiday, with parades, rallies, and other festivities. In the United States, the first Sunday in May was also traditionally celebrated as Decoration Day, a day to honor the nation's fallen soldiers.

## Labor Unrest in Europe

On this day, labor unions in several European countries organized strikes and demonstrations to demand better working conditions, higher wages, and greater social justice. In Germany, for example, thousands of workers took to the streets in cities like Berlin, Munich, and Hamburg, while in France, labor unions called for a general strike to protest against the government's economic policies.

# May 2, 1904 (Monday)

May 2, 1904, was a Monday, and it marked the second day of the month. In the world of sports, the Kentucky Derby was held at Churchill Downs in Louisville, Kentucky, with the horse Elwood emerging as the winner.

## Russo-Japanese War

The Russo-Japanese War continued to rage on, with both sides suffering heavy losses. On this day, Russian forces launched a major assault on the Japanese-held port city of Dalny, but were repelled with heavy casualties.

# May 3, 1904 (Tuesday)

May 3, 1904, was a Tuesday, and it marked the third day of the month. In the United States, the federal government announced plans to construct a new canal across the Isthmus of Panama, which would revolutionize global shipping and trade.

## Construction of the Panama Canal

The construction of the Panama Canal was a massive engineering project that would take several years to complete. On this day, the United States Army Corps of Engineers began work on the canal, which would eventually connect the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.

# May 4, 1904 (Wednesday)

May 4, 1904, was a Wednesday, and it marked the fourth day of the month. In the world of science, the French physicist Pierre Curie announced the discovery of a new element, which he named radium.

## Discovery of Radium

The discovery of radium was a major breakthrough in the field of physics, and it paved the way for further research into the properties of radioactive elements. On this day, Curie announced his findings to the French Academy of Sciences.

# May 5, 1904 (Thursday)

May 5, 1904, was a Thursday, and it marked the fifth day of the month. In the world of politics, the British government announced plans to grant self-government to the colonies of Canada and Australia.

## Imperial Reform

The British government's decision to grant self-government to its colonies was a significant step towards imperial reform. On this day, the British Prime Minister, Arthur Balfour, announced plans to establish dominion status for Canada and Australia.

# May 6, 1904 (Friday)

May 6, 1904, was a Friday, and it marked the sixth day of the month. In the world of sports, the first modern Olympic Games were held in St. Louis, Missouri, with athletes from 12 countries competing in various events.

## 1904 Summer Olympics

The 1904 Summer Olympics were a major international sporting event, and they marked the third time the Games had been held. On this day, the Games opened with a ceremony at Francis Field in St. Louis, Missouri.

# May 7, 1904 (Saturday)

May 7, 1904, was a Saturday, and it marked the seventh day of the month. In the world of entertainment, the first nickelodeon opened in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, offering short films to the public for a nickel.

## Birth of the Nickelodeon

The nickelodeon was a revolutionary new form of entertainment, and it paved the way for the development of the film industry. On this day, the first nickelodeon opened its doors to the public, offering short films and other attractions.

# May 8, 1904 (Sunday)

May 8, 1904, was a Sunday, and it marked the eighth day of the month. In the world of politics, the German government announced plans to increase its military spending in response to the growing threat of the Russo-Japanese War.

## Military Build-up in Germany

The German government's decision to increase its military spending was a significant step towards military build-up in Europe. On this day, the German Chancellor, Bernhard von Bülow, announced plans to increase the size of the German army.

# May 9, 1904 (Monday)

May 9, 1904, was a Monday, and it marked the ninth day of the month. In the world of science, the American inventor Thomas Edison announced the development of a new type of battery.

# May 10, 1904 (Tuesday)

May 10, 1904, was a Tuesday, and it marked the tenth day of the month. In the world of sports, the first modern boxing match was held in the United States, with Jack Johnson defeating Jim Jeffries for the heavyweight championship.

article:
2022 Uttar Pradesh Legislative Assembly Election

The 2022 Uttar Pradesh Legislative Assembly election was held in seven phases from 10 February to 7 March 2022 to elect all 403 members of the Uttar Pradesh Legislative Assembly. The election was a crucial test for the incumbent Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) government, led by Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, as well as for the opposition parties, including the Samajwadi Party (SP), Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP), and Indian National Congress (INC).

Background

### Panchayat Elections

In the lead-up to the 2022 assembly election, the state had witnessed panchayat elections in April-May 2021, which were seen as a semi-final to the assembly polls. The BJP had performed well in these elections, winning a majority of the zila panchayat chairman posts. However, the SP and BSP had also made significant gains, indicating a tough contest ahead.

### Political Developments

In the months preceding the election, several high-profile defections took place. The BJP lost two prominent ministers, Swami Prasad Maurya and Dara Singh Chauhan, who joined the SP. On the other hand, the SP lost several MLAs, including its Muslim face, Imran Masood, who defected to the Congress. The BSP also saw several defections, with some of its MLAs joining the BJP.

Schedule

The Election Commission of India (ECI) announced the schedule for the election on 8 January 2022. The election was held in seven phases, with the first phase taking place on 10 February and the last phase on 7 March. The counting of votes was held on 10 March.

Parties and Alliances

### National Democratic Alliance

The BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) consisted of the BJP, Apna Dal (Sonelal), and Nishad Party. The alliance had a clear majority in the outgoing assembly, with the BJP holding 303 seats.

### Samajwadi Party+

The Samajwadi Party (SP), led by Akhilesh Yadav, formed an alliance with several smaller parties, including the Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD), Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party (SBSP), and Apna Dal (Krishna Patel). The alliance was seen as a major challenger to the BJP.

### Bahujan Samaj Party

The Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP), led by Mayawati, contested the election alone, without forming any alliances.

### Indian National Congress

The Indian National Congress (INC) also contested the election alone, with its state unit being led by Priyanka Gandhi Vadra.

### Bhagidari Parivartan Morcha

The Bhagidari Parivartan Morcha, an alliance of several smaller parties, including the Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia), the Janwadi Party (Socialist), and the Rashtriya Loktantrik Party, also contested the election.

### Left Front

The Left Front, consisting of the Communist Party of India (CPI), Communist Party of India (Marxist) (CPI(M)), and Communist Party of India (Marxist-Leninist) Liberation (CPI(ML)L), also contested the election.

### Others

Several other parties and independent candidates also contested the election.

Candidates

A total of 6,744 candidates contested the election, including 1,118 women candidates.

Manifestos

### NDA

The BJP released its manifesto on 25 January 2022, promising several welfare schemes, including a pension scheme for small traders and a Rs 1 crore loan for start-ups. The party also promised to increase the minimum support price for sugarcane and wheat.

### BSP

The BSP released its manifesto on 27 January 2022, promising several measures to promote social justice and equality. The party promised to increase the reservation quota for SC/STs and OBCs and to provide free education to SC/ST students.

### UPA

The INC released its manifesto on 3 February 2022, promising several measures to promote economic growth and social welfare. The party promised to increase the minimum support price for farmers and to provide a Rs 1 lakh loan to small traders.

### SP+

The SP released its manifesto on 5 February 2022, promising several measures to promote social justice and equality. The party promised to increase the reservation quota for SC/STs and OBCs and to provide free education to SC/ST students.

Campaigns

The election campaign was marked by intense rivalry between the BJP and the SP, with both parties accusing each other of communalism and corruption.

### Policy Positions

#### Farm Laws

The BJP's decision to repeal the three farm laws, which had sparked widespread protests by farmers, was a major issue in the election. The party promised to increase the minimum support price for farmers and to provide a Rs 1 lakh loan to small traders.

### Election Issues

#### Stray Cow

The issue of stray cows was a major concern in the election, with many farmers complaining about the damage caused by the animals to their crops. The BJP promised to increase the number of cow shelters in the state and to provide a Rs 1 lakh loan to small traders.

#### Roads

The condition of roads in the state was another major issue in the election, with many voters complaining about the poor condition of roads in rural areas. The BJP promised to increase the number of roads in the state and to provide a Rs 1 lakh loan to small traders.

#### Petrol Diesel Price

The high price of petrol and diesel was a major concern in the election, with many voters complaining about the impact of the high prices on their daily lives. The BJP promised to reduce the price of petrol and diesel by Rs 5 per liter.

#### Inflation

The issue of inflation was a major concern in the election, with many voters complaining about the high price of essential commodities. The BJP promised to reduce the price of essential commodities by 10%.

#### Unemployment

The issue of unemployment was a major concern in the election, with many voters complaining about the lack of job opportunities in the state. The BJP promised to create 10 lakh new jobs in the state.

#### COVID-19

The COVID-19 pandemic was a major issue in the election, with many voters complaining about the government's handling of the pandemic. The BJP promised to increase the number of hospitals in the state and to provide free vaccination to all citizens.

Incidents

### Voting Machine Malfunction

Several incidents of voting machine malfunction were reported during the election, with many voters complaining about the machines not registering their votes.

### Unattended VVPAT Slips

Several incidents of unattended VVPAT slips were reported during the election, with many voters complaining about the slips not being counted.

### Voting Machine Theft

Several incidents of voting machine theft were reported during the election, with many voters complaining about the machines being stolen from polling booths.

### Postal Ballot in Garbage Truck

A postal ballot was found in a garbage truck in one of the constituencies, sparking widespread outrage among voters.

### Vote Rigging Allegations

Several allegations of vote rigging were made during the election, with many voters complaining about the government's attempts to rig the election.

Poll Predictions

### Opinion Polls

Several opinion polls were conducted during the election, with most of them predicting a close contest between the BJP and the SP.

### Exit Polls

Several exit polls were conducted during the election, with most of them predicting a win for the BJP.

Voter Turnout

The voter turnout in the election was 62.37%, with many voters complaining about the poor condition of polling booths and the lack of facilities.

Results

### Results by Alliance and Party

The BJP-led NDA won 273 seats in the election, with the BJP winning 255 seats. The SP-led alliance won 122 seats, with the SP winning 111 seats. The BSP won 1 seat, while the INC won 2 seats.

### Results by Division

The BJP won 71 seats in the Awadh division, while the SP won 23 seats. The BJP won 44 seats in the Kanpur division, while the SP won 15 seats. The BJP won 35 seats in the Gorakhpur division, while the SP won 12 seats.

### Results by District

The BJP won 13 seats in the Lucknow district, while the SP won 3 seats. The BJP won 9 seats in the Kanpur district, while the SP won 2 seats. The BJP won 8 seats in the Gorakhpur district, while the SP won 1 seat.

### Results by Polling Phase

The BJP won 44 seats in the first phase, while the SP won 15 seats. The BJP won 35 seats in the second phase, while the SP won 12 seats. The BJP won 29 seats in the third phase, while the SP won 9 seats.

### Results by Constituency

The BJP won the Lucknow Central constituency, while the SP won the Kanpur Cantonment constituency. The BJP won the Gorakhpur Urban constituency, while the SP won the Ghosi constituency.

* ^b The voter turnout in the election was 62.37%.

article:
Lokesh Cinematic Universe

The Lokesh Cinematic Universe (LCU) is a fictional universe created by Indian film director Lokesh Kanagaraj. The universe is a series of interconnected films that explore the lives of several characters, primarily set in the city of Chennai. The LCU has gained significant attention and acclaim for its unique storytelling, complex characters, and intricate connections between the films.

# Development
The development of the Lokesh Cinematic Universe began with the release of the 2019 film Kaithi, directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj. The film's success led to the creation of a larger universe, with subsequent films expanding on the characters and storylines introduced in Kaithi.

## Naming
The Lokesh Cinematic Universe was not officially named until the release of the 2022 film Vikram. In an interview, Lokesh Kanagaraj revealed that he had always envisioned a larger universe, but did not have a specific name for it until the release of Vikram. The name "Lokesh Cinematic Universe" was chosen to reflect the interconnected nature of the films and the creative vision of the director.

## In-franchise connections
The LCU is characterized by its complex web of connections between the films. Characters, plot points, and themes are woven throughout the universe, creating a rich and immersive experience for viewers. Lokesh Kanagaraj has stated that he aims to create a universe that is both cohesive and expansive, allowing for new stories and characters to be introduced while still maintaining connections to the existing films.

# Films
The LCU currently consists of three films, with several more in development.

## Kaithi (2019)

article:
Rocketry: The Nambi Effect

Rocketry: The Nambi Effect is a 2022 Indian biographical drama film written, produced, and directed by R. Madhavan in his directorial debut. The film is based on the life of Nambi Narayanan, a former Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) scientist who was falsely accused of espionage.

#Plot

The film tells the story of Nambi Narayanan, a brilliant scientist who played a crucial role in the development of the Vikas engine, which powered many Indian satellites into space. The story begins with Nambi's early days as a student at the Thiagarajar College of Engineering in Madurai, where he develops a passion for rocketry. He later joins ISRO and becomes a key member of the team that develops the Vikas engine.

However, Nambi's success is short-lived, as he is falsely accused of espionage by the Kerala Police in 1994. The police claim that Nambi had passed on sensitive information about the Vikas engine to two Maldivian women, who were allegedly spies for Pakistan. Nambi is arrested and subjected to intense interrogation, during which he is tortured and humiliated.

Despite the lack of evidence, Nambi is charged with espionage and spends several years in prison. His family, including his wife Meena and his two children, are devastated by the false accusations. Nambi's reputation is destroyed, and he is shunned by his colleagues and the scientific community.

The film follows Nambi's long and arduous journey to clear his name and restore his reputation. With the help of his family and a few loyal friends, Nambi fights against the corrupt system and eventually proves his innocence. The film ends with Nambi being exonerated and hailed as a hero for his contributions to Indian space research.

#Cast

* R. Madhavan as Nambi Narayanan
* Simran as Meena Narayanan, Nambi's wife
* Rajit Kapur as Vikram Sarabhai, the founder of ISRO
* Ravi Raghavendra as Unni, Nambi's colleague and friend
* Muralidaran as S. Nambi Narayanan's son
* Karthik Kumar as S. Nambi Narayanan's friend
* Dinesh Prabhakar as Kerala Police Officer
* Mohan Raman as Judge
* Bhawsheel Singh Sahni as Scientist
* Ron Donachie as Col. Cleve
* Phyllis Logan as Mrs. Cleve
* Vincent Riotta as Luca
* Jagan as ISRO Scientist

#Production

##Development

The film was first announced in 2018, with R. Madhavan set to play the lead role of Nambi Narayanan. Madhavan had been fascinated by Nambi's story and had spent several years researching his life and work. He had also met Nambi several times and had gained his trust and approval to tell his story.

Madhavan co-wrote the screenplay with Ananth Mahadevan and Rajesh Naithani. The film was produced by TriColour Films, in association with Varghese Moolan Pictures and Saffron Ganesha Entertainment.

##Filming

Principal photography began in October 2019 and took place in various locations in India, including Madurai, Thiruvananthapuram, and Bengaluru. The film was shot on a relatively low budget, with a mix of established and new actors.

Madhavan had to undergo a significant physical transformation to play the role of Nambi, who was in his 70s during the period depicted in the film. Madhavan lost weight, shaved his head, and grew a white beard to get into character.

#Music

The film's soundtrack was composed by Sam CS, with lyrics by Kalyani Menon and Raghu Dixit. The score was a mix of traditional Indian and Western classical music, reflecting Nambi's love of music and his passion for rocketry.

The soundtrack featured several notable songs, including "Har Har Shambhu" and "Khayaal". The music was well-received by critics and audiences, and helped to enhance the film's emotional impact.

#Marketing

The film's marketing campaign was led by P&A Media, a Mumbai-based marketing agency. The campaign focused on highlighting the film's unique story and its themes of patriotism, perseverance, and redemption.

The film's trailer was released in April 2022, and quickly went viral on social media. The trailer featured a mix of dramatic and emotional scenes, showcasing Madhavan's performance as Nambi.

#Release

##Theatrical

Rocketry: The Nambi Effect was released theatrically on July 1, 2022, in India and several other countries. The film received a wide release, with over 1,000 screens in India and several hundred screens overseas.

The film opened to positive reviews from critics, with many praising Madhavan's performance and the film's emotional impact. The film also performed well at the box office, grossing over ₹50 crore in its opening weekend.

##Home media

The film was released on Amazon Prime Video on August 5, 2022, several weeks after its theatrical release. The film was also released on DVD and Blu-ray in several countries.

#Reception

##Box office

Rocketry: The Nambi Effect performed well at the box office, grossing over ₹150 crore worldwide. The film was a commercial success, considering its relatively low budget.

##Critical response

The film received positive reviews from critics, with many praising Madhavan's performance and the film's emotional impact. The film holds a rating of 82% on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 20 reviews.

Several critics praised the film's storytelling, direction, and music. The Hindu wrote, "Rocketry: The Nambi Effect is a riveting biopic that tells an important story with conviction and passion."

#Awards and nominations

Rocketry: The Nambi Effect won several awards and nominations, including:

* National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Tamil
* Filmfare Award for Best Actor in a Leading Role (R. Madhavan)
* IIFA Award for Best Actor in a Leading Role (R. Madhavan)

#Notes

* The film is based on the life of Nambi Narayanan, a former Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) scientist who was falsely accused of espionage.
* R. Madhavan played the lead role of Nambi Narayanan and also directed the film.

House of Aberffraw

The House of Aberffraw was a royal house of Wales that ruled over the kingdom of Gwynedd from the 9th to the 13th centuries. The name "Aberffraw" refers to the location of the house's ancestral seat, Aberffraw on the island of Anglesey, which was an important power base for the dynasty. The House of Aberffraw produced several notable rulers, including Llywelyn the Great, who is considered one of the most successful Welsh princes of all time.

#Aberffraw hundred (cantref)

The Aberffraw hundred was a cantref, or administrative division, in the kingdom of Gwynedd. It was located on the island of Anglesey and was the ancestral seat of the House of Aberffraw. The hundred was an important power base for the dynasty, providing a secure location from which to launch military campaigns and govern the surrounding region.

#Welsh dynasties

The House of Aberffraw was one of several Welsh dynasties that rose to prominence during the Middle Ages. These dynasties were often at odds with one another, competing for power and territory. However, the House of Aberffraw was able to establish itself as one of the dominant forces in Wales, producing several notable rulers who played important roles in shaping the country's history.

##Succession

Succession within the House of Aberffraw was often a contentious issue, with different branches of the family competing for power. The dynasty followed a system of tanistry, in which the king or prince would designate a successor from among his family members. This system often led to power struggles and conflicts, as different branches of the family vied for control.

#Cambro-Norse era

During the Cambro-Norse era, which spanned from the 9th to the 11th centuries, the House of Aberffraw played an important role in shaping the kingdom of Gwynedd. The dynasty's rulers were often at odds with the Viking raiders who were attacking Wales, and they worked to establish a strong and secure power base from which to defend their territory.

The Norman invasion of Wales in the 11th century had a significant impact on the House of Aberffraw. The dynasty's rulers were forced to adapt to the changing circumstances, and they worked to establish a new power base from which to resist the Norman invaders. The House of Aberffraw was able to maintain its independence, but it was forced to navigate a complex web of alliances and rivalries with other Welsh dynasties and the Norman rulers of England.

##Aberffraw senior line

The Aberffraw senior line was a branch of the House of Aberffraw that produced several notable rulers, including Llywelyn the Great. This line was known for its strong leadership and military prowess, and it played an important role in shaping the kingdom of Gwynedd.

#Llys

The llys was the royal court of the House of Aberffraw, and it was the center of power and administration for the dynasty. The llys was often located at Aberffraw, but it could also be held at other locations throughout the kingdom.

##Rhosyr

Rhosyr was a settlement on the island of Anglesey that served as the location of the llys during the 13th century. The settlement was an important power base for the House of Aberffraw, and it was the site of several significant events in the dynasty's history.

##Aberffraw

Aberffraw was the ancestral seat of the House of Aberffraw, and it served as the location of the llys during much of the dynasty's history. The settlement was an important power base for the dynasty, providing a secure location from which to launch military campaigns and govern the surrounding region.

Llywelyn the Great was one of the most successful Welsh princes of all time, and he is considered the greatest ruler of the House of Aberffraw. He played a key role in shaping the kingdom of Gwynedd, and he worked to establish a strong and secure power base from which to resist the Norman invaders.

The dynasty's rulers worked to maintain their independence, but they were often forced to navigate a complex web of alliances and rivalries with other Welsh dynasties and the Norman rulers of England.

#Succession after the dynasty

The House of Aberffraw eventually came to an end, and the kingdom of Gwynedd was absorbed into the Principality of Wales. The succession of the dynasty was complex, with different branches of the family competing for power. However, the legacy of the House of Aberffraw continued to shape the history of Wales, and the dynasty's rulers remain an important part of the country's cultural heritage.

Partygate

Partygate is a political scandal in the United Kingdom that revolves around allegations of parties and gatherings held at 10 Downing Street, the official residence and office of the Prime Minister, during the COVID-19 pandemic. The scandal led to widespread criticism, resignations, and calls for Prime Minister Boris Johnson's resignation.

#Background

##COVID-19 lockdowns in the United Kingdom

The COVID-19 pandemic led to a series of lockdowns and restrictions in the United Kingdom, aimed at reducing the spread of the virus. The first national lockdown began in March 2020, followed by regional restrictions, and subsequent national and regional lockdowns throughout 2020 and 2021. During these periods, the government introduced various rules and guidelines to limit social gatherings, non-essential travel, and other activities.

##Westminster

The scandal is centered around 10 Downing Street, the official residence and office of the Prime Minister, located in Westminster, London. The street is a hub of British politics, with many government buildings, ministries, and the Houses of Parliament nearby. The close proximity of government offices and residences has raised questions about the culture and behavior of those working in Westminster.

#Timeline of reporting and reaction

The Partygate scandal unfolded over several months, with new revelations and developments emerging regularly.

##2021

###Up to 6 December

Initial reports of gatherings and parties at 10 Downing Street during the COVID-19 lockdowns emerged in early December 2021. The Guardian reported on a Christmas party held at Downing Street in December 2020, which allegedly breached COVID-19 rules.

###Stratton video (7–8 December)

On December 7, 2021, a video surfaced showing Allegra Stratton, the Prime Minister's then-press secretary, joking about a Christmas party at Downing Street during a mock press conference. The video, recorded on December 22, 2020, showed Stratton and other staff members discussing how to respond to questions about the party. The video sparked widespread outrage and led to Stratton's resignation on December 8, 2021.

###9 December onwards

##2022

The Prime Minister faced increased pressure to resign, with some Conservative Party MPs calling for him to step down.

###From 24 January

On January 24, 2022, the Prime Minister announced that he would be making a statement to the House of Commons about the parties and gatherings. In his statement, he apologized for attending a garden party at Downing Street in May 2020, but claimed that he had not broken any COVID-19 rules.

###After the conclusion of the police investigation

On May 19, 2022, the Metropolitan Police announced that it had concluded its investigation into the parties and gatherings at Downing Street. The investigation resulted in 126 fixed penalty notices being issued to 83 individuals, including the Prime Minister, for breaches of COVID-19 rules.

The report criticized the culture at Downing Street and found that there had been a failure of leadership and accountability. The report led to increased pressure on the Prime Minister to resign.

###Simon Case

Blue Beetle (film)
================

Blue Beetle is a 2023 American superhero film directed by Ángel Manuel Soto and produced by Warner Bros. Pictures, in association with DC Films. The film is based on the DC Comics character of the same name and stars Xolo Maridueña as the titular character. The film follows the story of Jaime Reyes, a teenager who discovers an alien scarab that bonds with him, giving him superhuman abilities.

Plot
-----

The film takes place in the fictional city of El Paso, Texas, where Jaime Reyes, a charismatic and resourceful teenager, lives with his family. Jaime's life takes a dramatic turn when he discovers an alien scarab that has been dormant for years. The scarab bonds with Jaime, giving him superhuman abilities, including super strength, agility, and the ability to create powerful blasts of energy.

As Jaime navigates his newfound powers, he must also contend with the villainous Carapax, a rogue alien warlord who seeks to conquer Earth. With the help of his family and friends, Jaime must learn to harness his powers and become the hero known as Blue Beetle.

* Damián Alcázar as Alberto Reyes

* George Lopez as Uncle Rudy
* Bruna Marquezine as Jenny Kord
* Belissa Escobedo as Milagros Reyes
* Harvey Guillén as Dr. Rodrigo

Production
------------

### Development

In 2018, it was announced that Warner Bros. Pictures had begun development on a Blue Beetle film, with Gareth Dunnet-Alcocer set to write the screenplay. The film was intended to be a part of the DC Extended Universe, but it was later decided to make the film a standalone project.

In 2020, Ángel Manuel Soto was hired to direct the film, with Xolo Maridueña cast as the titular character. The film's script was rewritten by Soto and Dunnet-Alcocer, with the story being reworked to focus more on Jaime's personal journey and his relationships with his family and friends.

### Writing

The screenplay for Blue Beetle was written by Gareth Dunnet-Alcocer and Ángel Manuel Soto. The script was influenced by the comic book series of the same name, as well as other DC Comics characters. ### Casting

Xolo Maridueña was cast as the titular character in 2020, after a lengthy casting process. Maridueña was chosen for his charisma and vulnerability, which were seen as key qualities for the role. The rest of the cast was assembled over the course of several months, with Adriana Barraza, Damián Alcázar, and Elpidia Carrillo being cast as Jaime's family members.

### Design

The film's production design was handled by Sharon Seymour, who worked closely with Soto to create a visually stunning film. The film's color palette was designed to reflect the vibrant culture of El Paso, with a focus on blues and oranges. The film's action sequences were choreographed by stunt coordinator, Jeff Imada.

### Filming

Principal photography for Blue Beetle began in June 2022 and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in El Paso, Texas, as well as in studios in Los Angeles. The film's cinematography was handled by Pawel Edelman, who used a combination of digital and film cameras to capture the film's unique look.

### Editing and visual effects

The film's editing was handled by Craig Alpert, who worked closely with Soto to create a fast-paced and action-packed film. The film's visual effects were handled by the visual effects company, Weta Digital. The company created the film's alien creatures, as well as the scarab that bonds with Jaime.

### Music

The film's score was composed by Bobby Krlic, who incorporated a mix of electronic and orchestral elements into the film's soundtrack. The film's soundtrack also features a number of Latin American artists, including Natalia Lafourcade and Rosalía.

---------

The film's poster was released several months later, featuring Xolo Maridueña as the titular character.

Release
--------

### Theatrical

Blue Beetle was released in theaters on August 18, 2023. The film was released in 3D and IMAX, as well as in standard formats. The film received a PG-13 rating from the Motion Picture Association of America.

### Home media

Blue Beetle was released on home media on November 21, 2023. The film was released on DVD, Blu-ray, and digital platforms, including Amazon Prime Video and Apple TV.

Blue Beetle was a commercial success, grossing over $100 million at the domestic box office. The film performed well internationally, grossing over $200 million worldwide.

Blue Beetle received positive reviews from critics, who praised the film's visuals, action sequences, and performances. The film holds a 82% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 200 reviews. Blue Beetle is intended to be a part of the DC Universe, with several sequels and spin-offs in development. The film's success has paved the way for a potential franchise, with Xolo Maridueña set to reprise his role as the titular character.

article:
Nope (film)

Nope is a 2022 American science fiction horror film written, directed, and co-produced by Jordan Peele. The film stars Daniel Kaluuya, Keke Palmer, and Brandon Perea, and marks Peele's third feature film as a director. Nope is a thought-provoking and visually stunning film that explores themes of spectacle, trauma, and the human condition.

#Plot

The film takes place on a remote ranch in California, where siblings OJ (Daniel Kaluuya) and Emerald (Keke Palmer) Haywood are struggling to maintain their family's horse training business after the sudden death of their father. One day, they begin to notice strange occurrences on the ranch, including unexplained sounds and movements. As the events escalate, the siblings discover that a mysterious and deadly creature is lurking in the skies above their property.

As OJ and Emerald try to uncover the truth behind the creature's origins and intentions, they are joined by Angel Torres (Brandon Perea), a tech-obsessed Fry's Electronics employee who becomes entangled in their quest. Together, they attempt to capture evidence of the creature's existence, while also navigating their own personal traumas and relationships.

Throughout the film, Peele employs a non-linear narrative structure, weaving together different storylines and timelines to create a sense of complexity and depth. The film's pacing is deliberate and measured, building tension and suspense as the characters edge closer to the truth.

#Cast

* Daniel Kaluuya as OJ Haywood
* Keke Palmer as Emerald Haywood
* Brandon Perea as Angel Torres
* Michael Wincott as Antlers Holst
* Steven Yeun as Ricky "Jupe" Park
* Barbie Ferreira as Nessie
* Wrenn Schmidt as Amber Park
* Keith David as Otis Haywood Sr.
* Donna Mills as Bonnie Clayton

The cast delivers strong performances, with Kaluuya and Palmer bringing a sense of nuance and depth to their characters. Perea, in particular, shines as the lovable but awkward Angel, providing much of the film's comic relief.

#Themes and interpretations

Nope is a film rich in themes and symbolism, inviting audiences to interpret its meaning in various ways. On one level, the film can be seen as a commentary on the power of spectacle and the ways in which we consume and process traumatic events. The creature, which is never fully explained, represents a force beyond human control, inspiring both awe and terror in those who witness it.

The film also explores the theme of trauma and its impact on individuals and families. OJ and Emerald's backstory, which is gradually revealed throughout the film, is marked by tragedy and loss, and their experiences are deeply intertwined with the mysterious events unfolding on the ranch.

Furthermore, Nope can be seen as a commentary on the exploitation of marginalized communities, particularly people of color and women. The character of Ricky "Jupe" Park, a former child star who has become a cult-like figure, serves as a symbol of the ways in which individuals can be commodified and exploited for the sake of entertainment.

#Production

##Development

Nope was first announced in November 2020, with Jordan Peele set to write, direct, and produce the film through his production company, Monkeypaw Productions. Peele had previously expressed interest in exploring the science fiction genre, and Nope marked his first foray into this territory.

The film's script was developed in collaboration with Peele's longtime writing partner, Ian Cooper. The two writers drew inspiration from a range of sources, including classic science fiction films, Westerns, and horror movies.

##Filming

Principal photography on Nope began in June 2021, with a cast and crew of over 100 people. The film was shot on location in California, with the majority of filming taking place on a remote ranch in the Antelope Valley.

Cinematographer Hoyte van Hoytema employed a range of innovative techniques to capture the film's stunning visuals, including the use of IMAX cameras and a custom-built rig to film the creature's aerial sequences.

##Creature design

The creature in Nope was designed by a team of artists and visual effects experts, led by Peele and van Hoytema. The creature's appearance was inspired by a range of sources, including UFOs, clouds, and animals.

The creature's design was intended to be both majestic and terrifying, with a shape-shifting form that seems to defy explanation. The visual effects team used a combination of practical and digital effects to bring the creature to life, with impressive results.

##Costumes

The costumes in Nope were designed by Ruth E. Carter, who has previously worked with Peele on Get Out and Us. Carter's costumes are meticulously detailed, reflecting the characters' personalities and backgrounds.

Emerald's costumes, in particular, are noteworthy, with a bold and eclectic style that reflects her confident and outgoing personality.

##Sound design

The sound design in Nope was led by Johnnie Burn, who has previously worked on a range of films, including Peele's Us. Burn's sound design is highly effective, creating a sense of tension and unease through the use of creaking doors, rustling leaves, and other unsettling sounds.

The film's score was composed by Michael Abels, who has previously collaborated with Peele on Get Out and Us. Abels' score is a key element of the film's atmosphere, with a haunting and evocative sound that perfectly complements the on-screen action.

##Music

The film's soundtrack features a range of songs, including tracks by The Doors, The Commodores, and The Isley Brothers. The soundtrack is carefully curated, with each song chosen to reflect the mood and tone of the scene in which it appears.

#Marketing

The marketing campaign for Nope was launched in February 2022, with a series of cryptic teasers and trailers that hinted at the film's mysterious plot. The campaign was highly effective, generating widespread interest and anticipation among horror fans and film enthusiasts.

The film's poster, which features a striking image of the creature, was widely shared on social media, with many fans attempting to decipher the image's meaning.

#Release

Nope was released in the United States on July 22, 2022, with a wide release in over 3,700 theaters. The film was also released in a range of international markets, including the UK, Canada, and Australia.

The film's release was accompanied by a range of promotional events, including a premiere at the American Film Institute and a Q&A session with Peele and the cast.

#Reception

##Box office

Nope was a commercial success, grossing over $250 million worldwide on a budget of $68 million. The film performed strongly in the United States, where it opened at number one at the box office and remained in the top five for several weeks.

##Critical response

Nope received widespread critical acclaim, with many reviewers praising the film's originality, atmosphere, and performances. The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with an average rating of 8.2/10.

Rolling Stone's David Fear praised the film as "a thrilling, thought-provoking, and deeply unsettling work of science fiction", while The New York Times' A.O. Scott described it as "a majestic and terrifying film that will leave you gasping for breath".

##Accolades

Nope has received a range of awards and nominations, including several Critics' Choice Awards and a nomination for Best Original Screenplay at the Academy Awards.

#Possible sequels

While there has been no official announcement regarding a sequel to Nope, Peele has expressed interest in exploring the film's universe further. In an interview with Entertainment Weekly, Peele stated that he had "a lot of ideas" for a potential sequel, but had not yet begun work on a script.

#Notes

Nope is a film that rewards close attention and multiple viewings, with a complex and layered narrative that invites interpretation and analysis. The film's themes of spectacle, trauma, and the human condition are timely and thought-provoking, making it a must-see for fans of science fiction and horror.

article:
1973 in the United States

The year 1973 was a transformative period in the United States, marked by significant events that shaped the country's politics, economy, culture, and society. This year saw the conclusion of the United States' involvement in the Vietnam War, the Watergate scandal, and the rise of the women's liberation movement. The economy experienced a period of high inflation, while the country continued to grapple with the effects of the 1970s energy crisis.

# Incumbents

## Federal government

* President: Richard Nixon (R) until August 9, then Gerald Ford (R)
* Vice President: Spiro Agnew (R) until October 10, then Gerald Ford (R)
* Speaker of the House of Representatives: Carl Albert (D)
* Senate Majority Leader: Mike Mansfield (D)
* Chief Justice: Warren E. Burger

# Events

## January

* January 2: The United States and the Soviet Union sign the Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty, aimed at limiting the development of missile defense systems.
* January 20: President Nixon delivers his second inaugural address, calling for an end to the Vietnam War and a new era of peace.
* January 22: The Supreme Court hands down its decision in the landmark case of Roe v. Wade, which establishes a woman's right to an abortion.

## February

* February 12: Operation Homecoming begins, marking the return of the first group of American prisoners of war from Vietnam.
* February 21: The United States, North Vietnam, and the Viet Cong sign the Paris Peace Accords, officially ending the United States' involvement in the Vietnam War.

## March

* March 8: The United States launches the Skylab space station, which is intended to serve as a habitable artificial satellite in Earth's orbit.
* March 29: The last American combat soldiers leave Vietnam, marking the end of the United States' military involvement in the conflict.

## April

* April 3: The first mobile phone call is made by Martin Cooper, an engineer at Motorola.
* April 6: The World Trade Center in New York City is officially dedicated, marking the completion of the iconic skyscraper complex.

## May

* May 14: Skylab is launched, but it suffers a malfunction and begins to orbit the Earth in an uncontrolled manner.
* May 25: The United States and the Soviet Union sign the Agreement on the Prevention of Nuclear War, aimed at reducing the risk of nuclear conflict.

## June

* June 1: The United States and the Soviet Union sign the SALT I treaty, which limits the development of strategic nuclear missiles.
* June 13: The United States and the Soviet Union sign the Threshold Test Ban Treaty, which prohibits the testing of nuclear devices with yields above 150 kilotons.

## July

* July 17: The US Senate votes to cut off funding for the bombing of Cambodia, marking a significant shift in public opinion against the Vietnam War.
* July 20: The United States launches the Pioneer 10 spacecraft, which is intended to study the outer Solar System.

## August

* August 8: Vice President Spiro Agnew resigns, amid allegations of corruption and tax evasion.
* August 9: Gerald Ford is sworn in as Vice President, replacing Agnew.
* August 17: The United States and the Soviet Union sign the Protocol to the Treaty on the Limitation of Strategic Offensive Arms, which limits the development of intercontinental ballistic missiles.

## September

* September 11: A military coup in Chile, backed by the United States, overthrows the democratically elected government of President Salvador Allende.
* September 18: The United States and the Soviet Union sign the Protocol to the Treaty on the Limitation of Strategic Defensive Arms, which limits the development of missile defense systems.

## October

* October 6: The Yom Kippur War breaks out, as Egypt and Syria launch a surprise attack on Israel.
* October 10: Vice President Spiro Agnew pleads no contest to charges of tax evasion and is sentenced to three years' probation.
* October 17: The Arab-Israeli War leads to a global oil embargo, which causes a significant increase in oil prices and contributes to the 1970s energy crisis.

## November

* November 7: The United States Congress overrides President Nixon's veto of the War Powers Resolution, which limits the President's ability to send troops into combat without Congressional approval.
* November 14: The United States and the Soviet Union sign the Agreement on the Prevention of Nuclear War, aimed at reducing the risk of nuclear conflict.

## December

* December 6: Gerald Ford is sworn in as Chairman of the President's Commission on CIA Activities within the United States, which is established to investigate allegations of CIA wrongdoing.
* December 26: The Soviet Union launches the Salyut 3 space station, which is intended to serve as a habitable artificial satellite in Earth's orbit.

## Ongoing

* The Watergate scandal continues to unfold, as investigations and hearings reveal widespread corruption and wrongdoing within the Nixon administration.
* The women's liberation movement gains momentum, as women across the United States demand greater equality and rights.
* The 1970s energy crisis continues to affect the United States, as high oil prices and shortages lead to widespread economic disruption.

article:
Dumas Malone

Dumas Malone (1892-1986) was a renowned American historian, best known for his comprehensive six-volume biography of Thomas Jefferson, "Jefferson and His Time." Malone's work on Jefferson is considered a seminal study of the third President of the United States, and his biography has had a lasting impact on the field of American historical scholarship.

#Early life and education

##Upbringing

Dumas Malone was born on January 10, 1892, in Coldwater, Mississippi, to a family with a strong literary and educational tradition. His parents, both schoolteachers, instilled in him a love of learning and a strong work ethic. Malone's early education took place in the public schools of Mississippi, where he developed a keen interest in history and literature.

##Ministry and Yale

After completing his secondary education, Malone attended Emory College in Oxford, Georgia, where he earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1910. He then went on to study theology at the Candler School of Theology, with the intention of becoming a Methodist minister. However, Malone's academic interests soon shifted towards history, and he began to pursue a career in historical scholarship. In 1916, he earned a Master of Arts degree from Yale University, where he would later return as a professor.

#Career

##Virginia and the DAB

Malone's first academic appointment was as an assistant professor of history at the University of Virginia, where he taught from 1916 to 1923. During this period, he became involved with the Dictionary of American Biography (DAB), a comprehensive biographical reference work that aimed to document the lives of notable Americans. Malone's work on the DAB helped to establish him as a reputable historian, and his research skills and attention to detail would serve him well in his later writing projects.

##Harvard University Press

In 1923, Malone joined the staff of Harvard University Press, where he worked as an editor and publications manager until 1929. During his tenure at Harvard, Malone oversaw the publication of numerous scholarly works, including several volumes of the DAB. His experience in publishing helped him to develop a keen eye for detail and a deep understanding of the publishing process.

##Return to Virginia

In 1929, Malone returned to the University of Virginia, where he was appointed as a professor of history. He remained at Virginia for the next 29 years, during which time he established himself as a leading authority on Thomas Jefferson and American history. Malone's teaching and research focused primarily on the colonial and early national periods of American history, and he supervised numerous Ph.D. dissertations on these topics.

#Legacy and honors

Malone's magnum opus, "Jefferson and His Time," was published in six volumes between 1948 and 1981. The work is considered a landmark study of Thomas Jefferson and has had a lasting impact on the field of American historical scholarship. Malone's biography of Jefferson has been praised for its meticulous research, engaging writing style, and nuanced interpretation of Jefferson's life and legacy.

Malone received numerous awards and honors for his work on Jefferson, including the Pulitzer Prize for History in 1975. He was also awarded the Thomas Jefferson Foundation Medal in 1976 and the National Humanities Medal in 1983.

#Personal life and death

Malone married Elizabeth Grieve in 1916, and the couple had two children, a son and a daughter. He was known for his warmth and generosity, and his love of music, literature, and good company. Malone died on December 19, 1986, at the age of 94, leaving behind a legacy as one of the most respected and beloved historians of his generation.

#Selected publications

2. "Jefferson and the Rights of Man" (1951)
3. "Jefferson and the Ordeal of Liberty" (1962)
4. "Jefferson the President: First Term, 1801-1805" (1970)
5. "Jefferson the President: Second Term, 1805-1809" (1974)
6. "The Sage of Monticello" (1981)

article:
2023 Emilia-Romagna Floods

The 2023 Emilia-Romagna floods were a series of severe floods that affected the Emilia-Romagna region of Italy in June 2023. The floods caused widespread damage and disruption, particularly in the provinces of Parma, Reggio Emilia, and Modena. This article provides an overview of the history, effects, reactions, and humanitarian efforts related to the floods.

#History

The 2023 Emilia-Romagna floods were the result of a prolonged period of heavy rainfall in the region, which began on June 10, 2023. The rain was caused by a low-pressure system that had formed over the Mediterranean Sea and had moved northwards, bringing heavy precipitation to the Emilia-Romagna region. The rainfall was particularly intense in the provinces of Parma, Reggio Emilia, and Modena, where the terrain is characterized by rolling hills and valleys.

Over the course of several days, the rainfall caused the rivers in the region to overflow, resulting in widespread flooding. The worst-affected areas were those near the rivers, including the cities of Parma, Reggio Emilia, and Modena. The floods also affected several smaller towns and villages in the region, causing significant damage to homes, businesses, and infrastructure.

#Effects

The 2023 Emilia-Romagna floods had a significant impact on the region, causing widespread damage and disruption.

##Emilia Romagna Grand Prix

One of the most notable effects of the floods was the impact on the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix, a Formula One racing event that was due to take place at the Imola circuit on June 18, 2023. The floods caused significant damage to the circuit and surrounding infrastructure, forcing the organizers to cancel the event.

The cancellation of the Grand Prix was a major blow to the region, which had been relying on the event to bring in tourism and revenue. The event was also seen as an important opportunity for the region to showcase its attractions and promote its economy.

##Bruce Springsteen concert controversy

Another notable effect of the floods was the controversy surrounding a concert by Bruce Springsteen, which was due to take place in the city of Parma on June 20, 2023. The floods caused significant damage to the venue, forcing the organizers to cancel the concert.

However, the cancellation of the concert was met with criticism from some fans, who accused the organizers of being too hasty in their decision. The controversy highlighted the challenges of organizing large events in areas prone to natural disasters.

#Reactions

The 2023 Emilia-Romagna floods prompted a range of reactions from local, national, and international authorities.

The Italian government declared a state of emergency in the affected regions, providing funding and resources to support relief efforts. The government also deployed military personnel to assist with evacuation and rescue operations.

The European Union also provided support, offering funding and expertise to help with relief efforts. The EU's Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated to provide satellite imagery and mapping data to support response efforts.

#Humanitarian efforts

A range of humanitarian efforts were launched in response to the floods, including evacuation and rescue operations, provision of shelter and food, and support for affected communities.

Local authorities and emergency responders played a key role in the response efforts, working to evacuate people from affected areas and provide support to those in need. Volunteer groups and NGOs also played an important role, providing support for affected communities and helping to distribute aid.

The Italian Red Cross was among the organizations that responded to the floods, providing support for evacuation and rescue operations, as well as provision of shelter and food to those in need.

article:
Tina Turner

Anna Mae Bullock, known professionally as Tina Turner, was a singer, songwriter, and actress whose successful music career spanned more than five decades. Born on November 26, 1939, in Nutbush, Tennessee, Turner rose to fame in the 1960s as the lead singer of the Ike & Tina Turner Revue and later became a solo artist. Known for her powerful voice, energetic live performances, and hit songs like "What's Love Got to Do with It," "Proud Mary," and "Private Dancer," Turner is widely regarded as one of the greatest entertainers of all time.

#Early life

Turner was born in Nutbush, Tennessee, to Zelma and Floyd Bullock. She was the youngest of three sisters. Turner's early life was marked by hardship and instability. Her parents separated when she was young, and she was raised by her grandparents in a small, rural community. Turner's love for music began at an early age, singing in the church choir and listening to blues and country music on the radio.

#Ike and Tina Turner

##Origins: 1956–1960

Turner's music career began in the mid-1950s when she met Ike Turner, a successful musician and bandleader, at a nightclub in St. Louis, Missouri. Turner was just 16 years old at the time, and Ike was 25. Ike was immediately impressed by Turner's powerful voice and recruited her to join his band, The Kings of Rhythm. Turner soon became the lead singer of the group, and the two began a romantic relationship.

##Early success: 1960–1965

Ike and Tina Turner's music career took off in the early 1960s with hits like "A Fool in Love" and "It's Gonna Work Out Fine." The duo's unique blend of rock and roll, blues, and R&B styles quickly gained popularity, and they became one of the most successful musical acts of the 1960s. Turner's energetic live performances and powerful voice earned her a reputation as one of the greatest female vocalists of all time.

##Mainstream success: 1966–1975

Ike and Tina Turner's success continued throughout the 1960s and 1970s with hits like "River Deep - Mountain High" and "Proud Mary." The duo's music was featured in several films and television shows, including the 1971 film "Soul to Soul" and the popular television show "The Ed Sullivan Show." Turner's fame extended beyond the music world, and she became a fashion icon and a symbol of female empowerment.

##Split: 1976

Ike and Tina Turner's personal and professional relationship ended in 1976 when Turner filed for divorce. The couple's marriage had been marked by domestic violence and infidelity, and Turner had become increasingly unhappy in the relationship. The divorce was highly publicized, and Turner's decision to leave Ike was seen as a bold move by many in the music industry.

#Solo career

##Early solo career: 1976–1982

Turner's solo music career began in 1976 with the release of her debut album, "Tina Turns the Country On." The album was not a commercial success, but it marked the beginning of Turner's journey as a solo artist. Turner continued to perform and record music throughout the late 1970s and early 1980s, releasing several albums, including "Love Explosion" and "Rough."

##Career resurgence and superstardom: 1983–2000

Turner's music career experienced a resurgence in the 1980s with the release of her album "Private Dancer." The album was a huge commercial success, selling over 11 million copies worldwide and spawning several hit singles, including "What's Love Got to Do with It" and "Better Be Good to Me." Turner's success continued throughout the 1980s and 1990s with albums like "Break Every Rule" and "Foreign Affair." Turner became one of the best-selling artists of all time, with over 100 million records sold worldwide.

##Later career: 2001–2021

Turner continued to perform and record music throughout the 2000s and 2010s, releasing several albums, including "Twenty Four Seven" and "All the Best." Turner's music career was marked by several farewell tours, including the 2008-2009 "Tina!: 50th Anniversary Tour" and the 2016-2017 "Tina Turner: The Musical" tour. Turner's final performance was on May 5, 2019, at the age of 79.

#Personal life

##Relationships and marriages

###Early relationships

Turner's early relationships were marked by hardship and instability. Turner's parents separated when she was young, and she was raised by her grandparents. Turner's first romantic relationship was with Ike Turner, whom she met in the 1950s.

###Ike Turner

Turner's relationship with Ike Turner was marked by domestic violence and infidelity. The couple married in 1962 and had two sons, Raymond and Ronald. Turner filed for divorce in 1976, citing irreconcilable differences.

###Erwin Bach

Turner met Erwin Bach, a German music executive, in the 1980s. The couple began a romantic relationship and married in 2013. Turner and Bach's relationship was marked by happiness and stability, and the couple lived together in Switzerland until Turner's death.

##Children

Turner had two sons, Raymond and Ronald, with Ike Turner. Turner also adopted two children, Ike Jr. and Michael, who were the sons of Ike Turner's previous relationships.

##Religious beliefs

Turner was a Buddhist and had been practicing Buddhism since the 1970s. Turner's faith played an important role in her life, and she often incorporated Buddhist principles into her music and performances.

##Residences, citizenship, and wealth

Turner lived in several countries throughout her life, including the United States, Switzerland, and the United Kingdom. Turner held citizenship in Switzerland and the United States. Turner's net worth was estimated to be over $250 million at the time of her death.

#Illness and death

Turner died on May 24, 2023, at the age of 83, after a long illness. Turner's death was met with an outpouring of tributes and condolences from fans and fellow musicians around the world.

#Musical legacy and accolades

##Awards, honors, and achievements

Turner won numerous awards and accolades throughout her career, including eight Grammy Awards, a Kennedy Center Honor, and a place in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Turner's music and legacy continue to inspire new generations of musicians and fans.

article:
1975 in the United States

The year 1975 was a significant one in the United States, marked by several major events that shaped the country's politics, economy, and culture. The nation was still reeling from the aftermath of the Watergate scandal, which had led to the resignation of President Richard Nixon in 1974. The economy was experiencing a period of high inflation and stagnant growth, which would come to be known as the 1970s stagflation. Despite these challenges, 1975 saw several notable achievements and events that would have a lasting impact on American society.

# Incumbents

## Federal government

* President: Gerald Ford (R-Michigan)
* Vice President: Nelson Rockefeller (R-New York)
* Speaker of the House of Representatives: Carl Albert (D-Oklahoma)
* Senate Majority Leader: Mike Mansfield (D-Montana)
* Chief Justice: Warren E. Burger

# Events

## January

* January 2: The United States and the Soviet Union agree to a joint space mission, which would later become the Apollo-Soyuz Test Project.

## February

* February 3: The US Supreme Court rules in the case of Bigelow v. Virginia, striking down a Virginia law that prohibited the distribution of abortion-related information.
* February 11: Margaret Thatcher becomes the leader of the British Conservative Party, the first woman to hold the position.
* February 21: Watergate scandal: former Attorney General Richard Kleindienst and two other Nixon administration officials are indicted for their roles in the scandal.

## March

* May 17: The US Supreme Court rules in the case of United States v. Jenkins, establishing the principle of executive privilege.

* June 2: The US and the Soviet Union agree to a joint space mission, which would later become the Apollo-Soyuz Test Project.

* June 10: The US Supreme Court rules in the case of Weinberger v. Salfi, limiting the ability of Congress to pass retroactive laws.

## July

* July 15: The Apollo-Soyuz Test Project is launched, featuring the first joint US-Soviet space mission.

## September

## October

article:
Prehistoric Planet

Prehistoric Planet is a documentary television series that premiered on Apple TV+ in 2022. The series is a natural history documentary that explores the lives of dinosaurs and other prehistoric creatures during the Late Cretaceous period, around 66 million years ago. The series was created by Jon Favreau and produced by BBC Studios Natural History Unit.

#Plot

Prehistoric Planet is set on a fictional planet, where dinosaurs and other prehistoric creatures roam free. The series follows the lives of various species, including the Tyrannosaurus Rex, Triceratops, and Velociraptor, as they hunt, mate, and survive in their environments. The series also explores the interactions between different species and the impact of climate change on their habitats.

Each episode of Prehistoric Planet features a different region of the planet, showcasing the unique characteristics of each ecosystem and the creatures that inhabit it. From the lush forests of the northern hemisphere to the arid deserts of the south, the series takes viewers on a journey through time, showcasing the diversity of life on Earth during the Late Cretaceous period.

#Production

Prehistoric Planet was produced by BBC Studios Natural History Unit, in association with Apple TV+. The series was created by Jon Favreau, who is known for his work on documentaries such as "Planet Earth" and "The Lion King". The production team used a combination of computer-generated imagery (CGI) and live-action footage to bring the prehistoric world to life.

The series was filmed on location in various parts of the world, including New Zealand, Canada, and the United States. The production team worked closely with paleontologists and scientists to ensure that the creatures and environments depicted in the series were as accurate as possible.

#Marketing

Prehistoric Planet was heavily promoted by Apple TV+ in the lead-up to its release. The series premiered on May 23, 2022, and was accompanied by a comprehensive marketing campaign that included social media promotions, online advertising, and print media.

The series was also promoted through a series of behind-the-scenes videos and interviews with the production team, which were released on the Apple TV+ website and social media channels. The videos provided a glimpse into the making of the series and highlighted the attention to detail and expertise that went into its production.

#Episodes

##Season 1 (2022)

The first season of Prehistoric Planet consisted of five episodes, each featuring a different region of the planet.

Episode 1: "Water World" - This episode explores the marine ecosystems of the planet, showcasing the diversity of life in the oceans.

Episode 2: "Desert Giants" - This episode takes viewers on a journey through the arid deserts of the southern hemisphere, where they meet the giant sauropod, Argentinosaurus.

Episode 3: "Forests of the North" - This episode explores the lush forests of the northern hemisphere, where viewers meet the massive hadrosaur, Edmontosaurus.

Episode 4: "Ice Worlds" - This episode takes viewers on a journey to the icy tundras of the northern hemisphere, where they meet the giant carnivore, Tyrannosaurus Rex.

Episode 5: "The Last Day" - This episode explores the final day of the Late Cretaceous period, where viewers witness the mass extinction event that wiped out the dinosaurs.

##Season 2 (2023)

The second season of Prehistoric Planet was released on May 22, 2023, and consisted of five new episodes.

Episode 1: "The Great Migration" - This episode explores the great migration of the hadrosaurs, as they travel to their wintering grounds.

Episode 2: "The Last Giants" - This episode takes viewers on a journey to the southern hemisphere, where they meet the giant sauropod, Patagotitan.

Episode 3: "The Feathered Fiends" - This episode explores the world of the feathered theropods, including the giant carnivore, Giganotosaurus.

Episode 4: "The Ancient Forests" - This episode takes viewers on a journey through the ancient forests of the northern hemisphere, where they meet the giant herbivore, Iguanodon.

Episode 5: "The End of the World" - This episode explores the final days of the Late Cretaceous period, as the mass extinction event approaches.

The Engwall family is a Swedish family with a rich history dating back to the 19th century. The family's roots are in the industrial and media sectors, with various members playing significant roles in shaping Sweden's economy and society. This article provides an overview of the Engwall family's history, highlighting key events, individuals, and achievements.

# Early History

The Engwall family's early history is not well-documented, but it is believed that the family originated from the province of Dalarna in central Sweden. The family's name is thought to be derived from the Swedish words "äng" meaning "meadow" and "vall" meaning "wall". The Engwalls were likely farmers or craftsmen, living in rural areas and working the land.

# Third Generation (late 19th–mid 20th century)

## Epoch of Sven Victor Engwall

Sven Victor Engwall (1850-1920) was a pivotal figure in the Engwall family's history. Born in Dalarna, Sven Victor moved to Stockholm at a young age to pursue a career in business. He quickly made a name for himself in the industrial sector, founding several companies, including the Engwall Iron Works and the Swedish Steel Company. Sven Victor's entrepreneurial spirit and innovative approach to business helped establish the Engwall family as a prominent force in Swedish industry.

## Expansion in Sweden

During Sven Victor's lifetime, the Engwall family expanded its interests in Sweden, venturing into various sectors, including media and pharmaceuticals.

### Swedish Media

The Engwall family's industrial interests continued to grow, with the establishment of new companies, including the Engwall Shipyard and the Swedish Engineering Company. These ventures helped solidify the family's position as a leading player in Swedish industry.

=============

DeMario DeWayne White Jr., professionally known as Moneybagg Yo, is an American rapper and songwriter. He gained widespread recognition in the mid-2010s and has since become one of the most prominent figures in the Southern hip-hop scene.

article:
Sonic Frontiers is an open-world action-adventure game developed by Sonic Team and published by Sega. It was released on November 8, 2022, for Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X/S. The game is part of the Sonic the Hedgehog series and marks a significant departure from the traditional Sonic formula.

# Gameplay

Sonic Frontiers takes place in an open-world environment, where players control Sonic as he explores a series of large, interconnected islands. The game features a mix of exploration, platforming, and combat, with Sonic's speed and agility being key to navigating the world.

The game's world is divided into several biomes, each with its unique landscape, enemies, and challenges. Players can explore these biomes freely, completing quests and collecting items to upgrade Sonic's abilities.

One of the game's key features is its "Cyloop" mechanic, which allows Sonic to create a loop of light that can be used to solve puzzles, defeat enemies, and traverse the environment. The game also features a variety of collectibles, including rings, which are used to upgrade Sonic's health and abilities.

# Plot

The game's story follows Sonic as he searches for his friends, who have gone missing on the mysterious Starfall Islands. As Sonic explores the islands, he discovers that they are inhabited by a group of ancient, robotic creatures known as the "Titans."

Sonic soon learns that the Titans are being controlled by a mysterious entity known as the "End," which is using them to destroy the world. Sonic must use his skills and abilities to defeat the Titans and stop the End.

## Another Story

In addition to the main story, the game also features a series of side quests and mini-games that provide additional context and backstory to the game's world and characters. These quests are presented as a series of "memory fragments" that Sonic discovers as he explores the world.

These memory fragments reveal more about the history of the Starfall Islands and the origins of the Titans and the End. They also provide insight into the motivations and personalities of the game's characters.

# Development

Sonic Frontiers was developed by Sonic Team, a Japanese video game development company that has been responsible for many of the Sonic games over the years. The game was directed by Morio Kishimoto, who has worked on several previous Sonic games.

## Conception

The idea for Sonic Frontiers was first conceived in 2019, when Sonic Team began brainstorming ideas for a new Sonic game. The team wanted to create a game that would depart from the traditional Sonic formula and offer a new type of gameplay experience.

The team was inspired by a variety of games, including The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Horizon Zero Dawn. They wanted to create a game that would offer a similar sense of freedom and exploration.

## Design

The game's design was led by Ian Flynn, who has worked on several previous Sonic games. Flynn wanted to create a game that would offer a sense of discovery and exploration, with a focus on Sonic's speed and agility.

The game's world was designed to be large and open, with a variety of biomes and environments to explore. The team used a combination of procedural generation and hand-crafted level design to create the game's world.

## Writing

The game's story was written by Ian Flynn and a team of writers. The story was designed to be more mature and complex than previous Sonic games, with a focus on character development and emotional depth.

The game's dialogue was written to be more naturalistic and conversational, with a focus on character personalities and relationships.

## Music

The game's music was composed by Tomoya Ohtani, who has worked on several previous Sonic games. The music was designed to be more atmospheric and ambient, with a focus on creating a sense of mood and atmosphere.

The game's soundtrack features a variety of themes and motifs, each of which is designed to evoke a specific emotion or mood. The music is used to enhance the game's story and gameplay, and to create a sense of immersion and engagement.

# Marketing and release

Sonic Frontiers was first announced in December 2020, with a teaser trailer that showed off the game's open-world environment and gameplay.

The game was released on November 8, 2022, for Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X/S.

# Reception

## Pre-release

Sonic Frontiers received a mixed response from critics and fans prior to its release. Some praised the game's open-world environment and gameplay, while others expressed concern about the game's departure from the traditional Sonic formula.

## Post-release

After its release, Sonic Frontiers received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising the game's open-world environment, gameplay, and story.

However, some critics expressed disappointment with the game's graphics and performance, particularly on the Nintendo Switch.

## Sales

Sonic Frontiers was a commercial success, selling over 2 million copies worldwide in its first week of release.

## Accolades

Sonic Frontiers received several awards and nominations, including a nomination for Best Action/Adventure Game at The Game Awards 2022.

# Notes

Sonic Frontiers is the first Sonic game to feature an open-world environment, and it marks a significant departure from the traditional Sonic formula.

The game's development was influenced by a variety of games, including The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Horizon Zero Dawn.

article:
Jugjugg Jeeyo
================

Jugjugg Jeeyo is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language comedy-drama film directed by Raj Mehta and produced by Karan Johar, Apoorva Mehta, and Hiroo Yash Johar under the banner of Dharma Productions and Viacom18 Studios. The film stars Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani, Anil Kapoor, Neetu Singh, Manish Paul, and Prajakta Koli.

Plot
-----

The film revolves around the story of two couples, Kuku and Naina, and Bheem and Geeta, who are going through a rough patch in their marriages. Kuku, played by Varun Dhawan, and Naina, played by Kiara Advani, are a young couple who are on the verge of divorce due to their differences. Bheem, played by Anil Kapoor, and Geeta, played by Neetu Singh, are Kuku's parents who have been married for over 30 years but are now seeking a divorce.

As the story unfolds, Kuku and Naina's relationship is put to the test when they visit Kuku's hometown, where they are forced to confront their issues and work through their problems. Meanwhile, Bheem and Geeta's decision to divorce sends shockwaves through the family, leading to a series of comedic and dramatic events.

Cast
-----

* Varun Dhawan as Kuku
* Kiara Advani as Naina
* Anil Kapoor as Bheem
* Neetu Singh as Geeta
* Manish Paul as Gurpreet
* Prajakta Koli as Ginny

Production
------------

The film was announced in November 2020, with Varun Dhawan and Kiara Advani confirmed to star in the lead roles. Anil Kapoor and Neetu Singh were later added to the cast, marking their first on-screen appearance together in over 30 years.

Principal photography began in December 2020 and took place in Chandigarh, Punjab, and other locations in North India. The film's script was written by Sumit Batheja, Anurag Singh, and Rishabh Sharma, with dialogues by Rishabh Sharma and Anurag Singh.

Release
-------

Jugjugg Jeeyo was released theatrically on June 24, 2022, in India and other countries. The film's trailer was released on May 22, 2022, and received a positive response from audiences and critics alike.

### Lawsuit

In June 2022, a lawsuit was filed against the film's producers, Karan Johar and Apoorva Mehta, alleging that the film's story was plagiarized from a script written by a Pakistani writer, Ali Abbas Zafar. The lawsuit claimed that Zafar had shared his script with Johar and Mehta, who had promised to produce the film but later backed out and went on to make Jugjugg Jeeyo using a similar storyline.

Soundtrack
------------

The film's soundtrack was composed by Tanishk Bagchi, Kanishk Seth, and Kumaar, with lyrics by Kumaar, Tanishk Bagchi, and Gurpreet Saini. The soundtrack features six tracks, including the hit singles "The Punjaabban Song" and "Rangisari".

Reception
----------

### Critical reception

Jugjugg Jeeyo received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising the film's performances, direction, and writing. The film holds a rating of 3.5 out of 5 stars on the review aggregation website, Bollywood Hungama.

The Indian Express praised the film's "well-crafted" storyline and the performances of the lead actors, stating that "Varun Dhawan and Kiara Advani bring a lot of charm to their characters". The Times of India also praised the film's performances, stating that "Anil Kapoor and Neetu Singh are excellent as the older couple".

However, not all reviews were positive. The Hindu criticized the film's "predictable" storyline and the "over-the-top" performances of some of the supporting actors.

### Box office

Jugjugg Jeeyo was a commercial success, grossing over ₹134 crore (US$17 million) worldwide. The film opened at number one at the Indian box office, grossing ₹9.28 crore (US$1.2 million) on its opening day. The film went on to gross over ₹67 crore (US$8.4 million) in its opening weekend, making it one of the highest-grossing films of 2022.

Accolades
----------

Jugjugg Jeeyo has received several awards and nominations, including the Filmfare Award for Best Supporting Actor, which was won by Anil Kapoor.

References
----------

External links
---------------
