article:
Seymour Hersh
================

Seymour Hersh is an American investigative journalist and author, best known for his exposés on government secrets and military operations. Born on April 8, 1937, in Chicago, Illinois, Hersh has had a long and distinguished career in journalism, working for various newspapers and magazines, including The New York Times and The New Yorker. He is widely regarded as one of the most important investigative journalists of his generation.

Early life and education
-------------------------

Hersh was born to a Jewish family in Chicago, Illinois. His father, Isador Hersh, was a salesman, and his mother, Freyda Hersh, was a homemaker. Hersh grew up in a middle-class neighborhood in Chicago and developed an interest in journalism at an early age. He attended the University of Chicago, where he studied history and graduated in 1958. After college, Hersh served in the United States Army Reserve, where he was stationed in Maryland.

Newspaper career
-----------------

### My Lai massacre

Hersh's breakthrough story came in 1969, when he reported on the My Lai massacre, a mass killing of Vietnamese civilians by American soldiers during the Vietnam War. Hersh's investigative reporting exposed the atrocities committed by American troops and brought attention to the incident, which had been previously covered up by the military. The story made headlines around the world and earned Hersh the Pulitzer Prize for International Reporting in 1970.

### The New York Times

In 1972, Hersh joined The New York Times as a investigative reporter. During his time at the Times, Hersh covered a range of topics, including the Watergate scandal and the CIA's involvement in the overthrow of the government of Chile. His reporting on the CIA's activities in Chile led to a Congressional investigation and the resignation of CIA Director Richard Helms.

Investigative books: 1980s and 1990s
-----------------------------------

In the 1980s and 1990s, Hersh wrote several investigative books that exposed government secrets and military operations. His book "The Price of Power: Kissinger in the Nixon White House" (1983) revealed the inner workings of the Nixon administration and the role of Henry Kissinger in shaping foreign policy. "The Samson Option: Israel's Nuclear Arsenal and American Foreign Policy" (1991) explored Israel's nuclear program and its implications for American foreign policy.

Later investigations
--------------------

### Iraq and Abu Ghraib

In 2004, Hersh reported on the Abu Ghraib prison abuse scandal, which involved American soldiers torturing and mistreating Iraqi detainees. His reporting exposed the extent of the abuse and the involvement of high-ranking military officials. Hersh also reported on the use of chemical weapons by American forces in Iraq and the presence of al-Qaeda in the country.

### Iran

In 2012, Hersh reported on the Obama administration's secret dealings with Iran, including a covert operation to sabotage Iran's nuclear program. He also reported on the CIA's role in the assassination of Iranian nuclear scientists.

### Syria and chemical attacks

In 2013, Hersh reported on the Syrian government's alleged use of chemical weapons against civilians. He questioned the official narrative and suggested that the attack may have been carried out by rebel forces.

### Killing of Osama bin Laden

In 2015, Hersh reported on the killing of Osama bin Laden, challenging the official narrative of the operation. He suggested that the Pakistani military had been involved in the operation and that bin Laden had been living in a safe house in Abbottabad, Pakistan.

### Nord Stream pipeline and Ukraine

In 2022, Hersh reported on the sabotage of the Nord Stream pipeline, suggesting that the Biden administration had been involved in the operation. He also reported on the CIA's involvement in the Ukraine conflict and the role of American intelligence agencies in shaping Ukrainian policy.

Other statements
-----------------

### Speeches

Hersh has given several speeches and lectures on investigative journalism and government secrecy. In a 2013 speech at the University of California, Berkeley, he criticized the Obama administration's handling of national security and the role of the media in covering up government secrets.

### Murder of Seth Rich

In 2017, Hersh suggested that the murder of Democratic National Committee staffer Seth Rich may have been connected to the WikiLeaks release of Democratic Party emails. He also questioned the official narrative of Rich's murder and suggested that the FBI may have been involved in a cover-up.

### Pat Nixon abuse

In 2019, Hersh reported on allegations of physical and emotional abuse by Pat Nixon, the wife of President Richard Nixon. He suggested that the abuse had been covered up by the Nixon administration and that Pat Nixon had been involved in the Watergate scandal.

Use of anonymous sources
-------------------------

Hersh has been criticized for his use of anonymous sources in his reporting. He has defended his use of anonymous sources, arguing that they are necessary to expose government secrets and corruption.

Personal life
-------------

Hersh is married to Elizabeth Sarah Klein, a psychotherapist. They have two children and live in Washington, D.C.

Awards and honors
-----------------

Hersh has won numerous awards for his journalism, including the Pulitzer Prize, the Polk Award, and the Overseas Press Club Award.

Publications
-------------

### Books

* "Chemical and Biological Warfare: America's Hidden Arsenal" (1968)
* "My Lai 4: A Report on the Massacre and Its Aftermath" (1970)
* "Cover-Up: The Army's Secret Investigation of the Massacre at My Lai 4" (1972)

article:
2023 SAFF Championship

The 2023 SAFF Championship, also known as the 2023 South Asian Football Federation Championship, is the 13th edition of the SAFF Championship, a biennial international football tournament contested by the national teams of the South Asian Football Federation (SAFF). The tournament is scheduled to take place in India from June 21 to July 4, 2023.

# Host selection

India was awarded the hosting rights for the 2023 SAFF Championship in October 2022, after the SAFF Executive Committee meeting in Dhaka, Bangladesh. This marks the second time India has hosted the tournament, having previously done so in 2011.

# Participating nations

A total of eight teams participated in the 2023 SAFF Championship, including the host nation India. The participating nations were:

*  Bangladesh
*  Bhutan
*  India
*  Kuwait
*  Lebanon
*  Maldives
*  Nepal
*  Pakistan

## Squads

Each participating nation submitted a squad of 23 players for the tournament. The squads were announced in the weeks leading up to the tournament.

# Venue

The 2023 SAFF Championship was played at two venues in India: the Sree Kanteerava Stadium in Bengaluru and the EMS Stadium in Kozhikode.

# Draw

The draw for the 2023 SAFF Championship took place on May 17, 2023, in New Delhi, India.

## Draw result

The eight teams were drawn into two groups of four teams each. The groups were drawn as follows:

Group A:

*  India
*  Kuwait
*  Nepal
*  Pakistan

Group B:

*  Bangladesh
*  Bhutan
*  Lebanon
*  Maldives

# Officiating

A total of 10 referees and 10 assistant referees were appointed for the 2023 SAFF Championship. The referees and assistant referees were from various countries in Asia.

# Group stage

The group stage of the 2023 SAFF Championship took place from June 21 to June 28, 2023. Each team played the other teams in their group once, with the top two teams from each group advancing to the knockout stage.

article:
E.A.T. (TV program)
=====================

E.A.T. is a long-running Filipino noon-time variety show that has been a staple of Philippine television for over four decades. The show has undergone several format changes, network transfers, and host line-ups, but its popularity endures. This article provides an overview of the show's history, hosts, segments, ratings, controversies, and spin-offs.

History
--------

### RPN (1979–1989)

E.A.T. was first aired on July 30, 1979, on Radio Philippines Network (RPN) as a noon-time variety show featuring a mix of entertainment, comedy, and public service. The original hosts were Tito Sotto, Vic Sotto, and Joey de Leon, collectively known as the "Tito, Vic, and Joey" (TVJ) trio. During its early years, the show was known for its wacky humor, witty banter, and charitable causes.

### ABS-CBN (1989–1995)

In 1989, E.A.T. transferred to ABS-CBN, where it continued to gain popularity and expand its audience reach. The show's format remained largely the same, with the TVJ trio at the helm. During this period, the show became known for its "Barangay Bulagaan" segment, which featured a mock court where viewers could air their grievances and seek justice.

### GMA Network (1995–2024)

In 1995, E.A.T. moved to GMA Network, where it became one of the network's flagship programs. The show's format underwent significant changes, with new segments and hosts added to the mix. The TVJ trio remained the main hosts, but they were joined by other personalities, including Paolo Ballesteros, Wally Bayola, and Maine Mendoza.

### TVJ - TAPE Inc. conflict (2023–2024)

In 2023, a public feud erupted between the TVJ trio and TAPE Inc., the production company behind E.A.T. The conflict centered on issues of creative control, compensation, and trademark ownership. The dispute led to a series of public statements, lawsuits, and countersuits.

#### E.A.T. and TAPE's Eat Bulaga!

At the heart of the conflict was the issue of trademark ownership. TAPE Inc. claimed ownership of the "Eat Bulaga" trademark, which the TVJ trio disputed. The TVJ trio argued that they were the original creators and owners of the show's concept, format, and trademarks.

#### Eat Bulaga! trademark battle: TVJ emerges victorious

After a series of court battles, the TVJ trio emerged victorious, with the court ruling in their favor. The decision allowed the TVJ trio to continue using the "Eat Bulaga" trademark, paving the way for their eventual departure from GMA Network.

### TV5 and RPTV (since 2024)

In 2024, E.A.T. transferred to TV5 and RPTV, marking a new chapter in the show's history. The TVJ trio remains at the helm, with a revamped format and new segments.

Hosts
------

### Current host

* Tito Sotto
* Vic Sotto
* Joey de Leon

### Former host

* Paolo Ballesteros
* Wally Bayola
* Maine Mendoza

Segments
--------

### Current segments

#### Sugod Bahay, Mga Kapatid!

A segment where the hosts visit a lucky viewer's home and surprise them with gifts and prizes.

#### Gimme 5: Laro ng mga Henyo

A segment where contestants compete in a series of challenges and puzzles to win prizes.

#### Peraphy

A segment where the hosts play a parody of popular songs, with humorous lyrics and performances.

#### Barangay Bulagaan

A segment where viewers can air their grievances and seek justice in a mock court.

#### Dear Eat Bulaga

A segment where viewers can write in and ask for advice on various issues, from relationships to career choices.

#### Eat Bulaga Olympics

A segment where contestants compete in a series of physical and mental challenges to win prizes.

#### Bawal! Judgmental Ka Ba?

A segment where contestants are challenged to make difficult decisions and judgments, with humorous results.

### Concluded segments

#### Mr. Cutie: Boys Got Talent (2023–2024)

A talent show segment where male contestants competed to win prizes and recognition.

#### Babala! 'Wag Kayong Ganuuun... (2023–2024)

A segment where the hosts played pranks and surprised each other with humorous results.

#### That's My Boyfriend (2024)

A segment where female contestants competed to win the affection of a mystery boyfriend.

#### Rewind: The Comeback Stage (2024)

A segment where former contestants returned to compete in a series of challenges and puzzles.

#### EB Centerstage

A segment where viewers could showcase their talents and performances.

#### Barangay Cinema: Child Star of the Year (2024)

A segment where child actors and actresses competed to win recognition and prizes.

Ratings
--------

E.A.T. has consistently been one of the highest-rated noon-time variety shows in the Philippines. The show's ratings have fluctuated over the years, but it remains a staple of Philippine television.

Controversies
-------------

E.A.T. has been involved in several controversies over the years, including the TVJ-TAPE Inc. conflict and issues of creative control and trademark ownership.

Spin-offs
----------

### Eat Na Ta!

A spin-off show that aired on GMA Network, featuring a similar format and hosts.

### International versions

#### Eat Bulaga! Indonesia and The New Eat Bulaga! Indonesia

A Indonesian version of the show that aired on SCTV and MNCTV.

#### Eat Bulaga! Myanmar

A Burmese version of the show that aired on 5 Plus.

Notes
-----

E.A.T. is widely regarded as one of the most successful and enduring noon-time variety shows in Philippine television history. The show's ability to adapt and evolve has allowed it to remain relevant and popular over the years.

References
----------

External links
